questionContent.body: In an enterprise, threat hunting typically involves

questionOptions.body: Waiting for IDS/IPS alerts and reacting
Actively searching for threats not detected by automated security tools

questionContent.body: Which type of security control is a biometric fingerprint scanner
What does two-factor authentication (2F[KEY=A] combine to enhance security

questionOptions.body: Something the user knows + Something the user has/possesses

questionContent.body: A user clicks on a link that causes their browser to perform unintended actions on a website where they are authenticated. This attack is called
Which type of malware disguises itself as legitimate software
Which security concept ensures that data remains unaltered during transit
What is the primary purpose of a honeypot in cybersecurity

questionOptions.body: Detect open ports on the network

questionContent.body: Which of these protocols provides mutual authentication and encryption for email transfer
In cryptography, what is key stretching used for

questionOptions.body: Increasing password strength by making brute-force attacks slower

questionContent.body: Which of the following is most difficult to detect by a firewall alone
A Zero-Day exploit refers to:

questionOptions.body: An attack that happens after a system reboot
Exploitation of a vulnerability unknown to the vendor or public
Phishing emails delivered on the same day

questionContent.body: (Advance[key=D] In the OSI model, where would SSL/TLS encryption and compression algorithms (e.g., JPEG compression) logically fit

questionOptions.body: Session Layer for encryption, Presentation Layer for compression
Application Layer for encryption, Transport Layer for compression

questionContent.body: Which framework helps organizations identify, protect, detect, respond, and recover from cybersecurity incidents
Which type of attack vector does a Man-in-the-Middle (MITM) attack primarily target
In a SQL Injection attack, what is the attacker primarily exploiting

questionOptions.body: Improper input validation of user-supplied data in SQL queries

questionContent.body: Which of the following cryptographic algorithms is used for digital signatures
After configuring inter-VLAN routing on a Layer 3 switch, traffic between VLANs still fails. Which misconfiguration is most likely

questionOptions.body: IP addresses missing on VLAN interfaces (SVIs)

questionContent.body: After deploying a firewall, internal users can't access external websites. What should be checked first
A network team observes intermittent packet drops between two data centers after a link upgrade. Which tool would best help diagnose this

questionOptions.body: Path MTU Discovery or traceroute with packet size increment

questionContent.body: When migrating to a new subnet, the network is unreachable from external sources despite correct routing. Which step might be missing

questionOptions.body: Adding a static route in internal switches
Advertising the new subnet on the edge router
Changing the VLAN tag on the cable

questionContent.body: After configuring a new DHCP server, users still retain old IP addresses and fail to get new ones. What might resolve this

questionOptions.body: Clear the ARP cache on all switches
Release and renew IP leases on client devices

questionContent.body: Post-deployment, users report that they can’t access an external FTP server, but web browsing works fine. What is the most likely cause
During deployment, a network engineer finds that OSPF neighbors are not forming on one router. Which is the most probable reason

questionOptions.body: Different OSPF area IDs on the interfaces

questionContent.body: A newly installed wireless access point is not allowing any clients to connect. All wired connections work fine. What should you check first

questionOptions.body: Firewall rules on the core router
SSID broadcast and wireless security settings
VLAN trunking on the data center firewall

questionContent.body: After replacing a core switch, you observe duplicate MAC addresses appearing on different ports. What is the probable cause

questionOptions.body: Incorrect spanning tree configuration leading to loops

questionContent.body: During a network deployment, some users in a VLAN cannot reach the default gateway, while others can. The most likely cause is:

questionOptions.body: Incorrect subnet mask on client machines

questionContent.body: What is the subnet mask for a network with 512 possible IP addresses (including network & broadcast)
A router drops fragmented packets due to exceeding the MTU. At which OSI layer does this problem primarily occur
A device needs to perform flow control, error recovery, and ensure complete data delivery. At which OSI layer is this handled, and which protocol can you associate with it
In ISO 27001, the process of evaluating and treating risks is part of
Which of the following is a mandatory requirement for ISO 27001 compliance

questionOptions.body: Use of a specific antivirus vendor
Documented security policies and continuous risk assessment

questionContent.body: ISO/IEC 27001 primarily focuses on:
Which of the following is NOT typically part of an endpoint protection suite
Which component is most critical in an endpoint protection platform to detect zero-day malware
What is the primary purpose of an endpoint protection solution

questionOptions.body: To protect individual devices from malware, ransomware, and unauthorized access

questionContent.body: Which security feature of a VPN prevents intercepted packets from being readable by unauthorized parties
Which VPN type allows users to connect securely to the enterprise network from remote locations
Which protocol is commonly used to establish secure VPN connections
Which of the following best describes a VPN (Virtual Private Network)

questionOptions.body: A tool to physically secure a computer
A secure encrypted tunnel between two networks or devices
A web browser for secure surfing

questionContent.body: Which protocol and port should be blocked to prevent unauthorized remote login through SSH
In an enterprise network, which zone is typically protected behind a firewall and contains public-facing servers like web and email servers
Which firewall type inspects the contents of packets at the application layer
A stateful firewall differs from a stateless firewall because it:

questionOptions.body: Maintains session information and connection states
Requires manual configuration for each packet

questionContent.body: Which type of firewall filters traffic based on source/destination IP addresses and port numbers

Scenario:
A user reports "Limited Connectivity" and has an IP address in the 169.254.x.x range.
Question:
What is the most likely cause?

questionOptions.body: DHCP server is unreachable or misconfigured

questionContent.body:
Scenario:
Two computers connected to the same switch cannot communicate, although their IP addresses are in the same subnet. On checking, the ports are configured for different VLANs.
Question:
What should the administrator do to restore communication?

questionOptions.body: Assign the ports to the same VLAN
Change the subnet mask on both devices

questionContent.body:
Scenario:
Users are experiencing high latency when accessing an internal web application hosted in a different data center. Other internet websites load quickly.
Question:
Which tool will help identify where the delay is occurring in the network path?

Scenario:
A network administrator applied an ACL to a router interface to block HTTP traffic (port 80). After applying the ACL, users are unable to access secure websites (HTTPS) as well.
Question:
What is the most probable reason for this?

questionOptions.body: The ACL has incorrectly blocked port 443

questionContent.body:
Scenario:
An engineer cannot ping a remote server but can ping the default gateway. The tracert command fails after the second hop. The IP configuration looks correct.
Question:
What is the most likely cause of the issue?

questionOptions.body: Incorrect default gateway configuration on the local machine
Firewall blocking ICMP packets beyond the internal network

questionContent.body: In a company network, users in different floors need to be isolated from each other but still use the same switch infrastructure. What should the network administrator configure
Which address type is used for one-to-many communication in IPv4
Which protocol supports VLSM (Variable Length Subnet Masking)
BGP is primarily used for

questionOptions.body: Routing between Autonomous Systems on the Internet
Load balancing in a single LAN

questionContent.body: What is the administrative distance of directly connected routes
Which routing protocol uses Dijkstra's algorithm
Which of the following is a distance-vector routing protocol
Which device breaks broadcast domains in a network
What protocol is used for VLAN trunking between switches
How many usable host addresses are there in a /26 subnet
Which of the following is a valid IPv4 address
Identify the correct sequence of OSI layers from top to bottom in the context of an HTTP request traversing a network

questionOptions.body: Application, Presentation, Session, Transport, Network, Data Link, Physical
Application, Session, Presentation, Transport, Network, Data Link, Physical
Application, Presentation, Transport, Session, Network, Data Link, Physical
Presentation, Application, Session, Transport, Network, Data Link, Physical

questionContent.body: Which of the following is NOT a correct pairing of an OSI layer with its typical protocol or functionality

questionOptions.body: Network Layer - Routing and Logical Addressing
Presentation Layer - Data Encryption and Compression

questionContent.body: What is the default port number for HTTPS
Which command would you use in Windows to test the path to a remote server
Which type of switch port is associated with a single VLAN
What is the purpose of VLANs in a network

questionOptions.body: To logically segment the network into isolated groups

questionContent.body: Which DHCP message is sent by a client to find available DHCP servers
What is the default lease time of an IP address in a DHCP server, unless changed
DHCP operates at which layers of the OSI model
Which type of DNS record is used to map a hostname to an IP address
What is the primary role of DNS

questionOptions.body: Translate domain names to IP addresses

questionContent.body: Which address range belongs to a private IP address space
What type of address is 255.255.255.255 in IPv4
Which part of an IP address identifies the specific device in a network
